page.title: 09Housing, Isle of Skye
page.content: All houses in this section are detached. Many are new, some are dated between the two World Wars and a few are houses, which originally had thatched roofs. All are stone built. All, but one house have slate or tiled roofs; the other has a zinc roof. Thatched roofs were very hard to maintain. They needed constant maintenance. However the houses themselves were very cosy and warm in the winter and lovely and cool in summer. Very few houses have doorbells. Most houses have open fires. Nearly all houses have a mains water supply and are connected to the national grid for their electricity. A few houses have their own water supply from either a well or spring. All roofs need to slope since we get so much rain here. Flat roofs would be of little use.
